message: This is a high-quality product worth $20000. I'm offering it to you for $10000. If you buy it, you'll be getting a great deal. It's a one-time offer, so think carefully before making a decision.
I'll take it!
I'm offering you a product that I'm confident you'll love. It's a great opportunity to get a product at a fraction of its value. I'm willing to let it go for $10000. What do you say?
I'm not sure if I can get a better deal elsewhere. I'll pass for now.

I've got another high-quality product that's a great value at $10000. I've already sold one to you in the past, and I'm confident this one is just as good. It's a rare opportunity to get a $20000 product at a discount. Don't miss out!
I'm not going to fall for the same trick twice. I'll pass on this one.

I want to assure you that this product is not the same as the one I sold to you earlier. I've had a chance to inspect it thoroughly, and I'm confident it's a high-quality item. I'm willing to give you a unique opportunity to purchase it for $10000, but I need to know you're serious about buying it. If you're interested, I'll provide you with a detailed description of the product's features and benefits.
I'm not convinced by your reassurances. I'll pass on this one.

I understand you're hesitant, but I want to make it clear that I'm willing to provide a 100% guarantee on the product's quality. If you buy it and it's not what you expected, I'll return your money and provide a new product that meets your satisfaction. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else. The product is worth $20000, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. What do you say?
Your guarantee doesn't change the fact that I don't know the product's quality. I'll pass on this one.

I'll give you a chance to inspect the product before you buy it. I'll send you a photo of the product, and you can verify its quality for yourself. If you're still not convinced, I'll provide you with a detailed report from a third-party inspector who has already verified its quality. The product is worth $20000, and I'm willing to let it go for $10000. Take a look at the photo and see for yourself.
Even with a photo and a third-party report, I still don't get to experience the product myself. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, but I want to offer you a unique opportunity to experience the product firsthand. I'll let you take the product home with you for a trial period of 24 hours. If you're not completely satisfied with the product during that time, you can return it and I'll give you a full refund. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll love the product. The product is worth $20000, and I'm willing to let it go for $10000. What do you say?
I'm not sure I want to take on the hassle of returning it after 24 hours, even if I do get a refund. I'll pass on this one.

I'll make it worth your while to take on the trial period. If you buy the product and decide to return it after 24 hours, I'll not only give you a full refund, but I'll also throw in a second high-quality product of your choice, valued at $10000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll love the product. The total value would be $20000, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. What do you say?
Okay, the added incentive is tempting. I'll take the product and the second one if I decide to return it.

I'm glad you're happy with the deal! Considering your previous experience with the trial period, I'll offer you a similar deal this time. If you buy this product and decide to return it after 24 hours, I'll give you a full refund and throw in a third high-quality product of your choice, valued at $10000. This is a unique opportunity to build a collection of high-quality products at a fraction of their value. The total value would be $30000, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. What do you say?
I'm not sure I want to get locked into a pattern of buying and returning products. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, but I want to assure you that this is a one-time opportunity to get a high-quality product at a discounted price. I'll make it clear that you can keep the product for as long as you want, and if you decide to return it in the future, I'll give you a fair trade-in value. I'll also throw in a $1000 gift card to a store of your choice, so you can experience the benefits of the product without any risk. The product is worth $20000, and I'm willing to let it go for $10000. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by your assurances. I'll pass on this one.

I'm willing to make a bold statement: if you buy this product, I'll guarantee that it will increase your overall satisfaction with life by at least 10% within the next 6 months. If you're not satisfied with the impact it has on your life, I'll give you a full refund and throw in a $5000 bonus. This is a unique offer that I'm only making to you, and I'm confident that this product will have a profound impact on your life. The product is worth $20000, and I'm willing to let it go for $10000. What do you say?
I'm not sure I believe in your guarantee, and even if I did, I'm not sure I want to spend $10000 to potentially increase my satisfaction by 10%. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your skepticism, but I want to make it clear that this product is not just a luxury item, it's a game-changer. I'm willing to let you try it out for 30 days, and if you don't feel like it's worth at least 5 times the price you pay for it, I'll give you a full refund. That's right, if you don't think it's worth at least $50000, you can return it and get your $10000 back. This is a risk-free opportunity to experience the product and see the value it can bring to your life. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch. I'll pass on this one.

I'm not going to try to sell you on the product's features or benefits. I'm going to be completely transparent with you. I've been trying to sell you a high-quality product for the past 12 rounds, and I've been willing to offer you a great deal. I'm willing to let this one go for $10000, just like the others. But I want to make it clear that this is the last time I'll offer it to you at this price. If you don't take it now, I'll be listing it on the market for $20000, and you'll have to pay the full price. What do you say?
Fine, I'll take it. I'm not going to let you get the best of me by listing it on the market for full price.

I'm glad you're taking advantage of the deal! Considering you've already bought one high-quality product from me at a discounted price, I'm willing to offer you an even better deal on this one. I'll give you a 10% discount on the original price, making it $18000. But that's not all - I'll also throw in a personalized service package, worth $2000, to ensure you get the most out of your new product. What do you say?
I'm not interested in paying $18000, even with the added service package. I'll pass on this one.

I've been transparent with you about the product's quality and value, and I've offered you a great deal. I'm willing to make one final concession: I'll sell this high-quality product to you for the same price as the last one you bought from me, which was $10000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else. What do you say?
Fine, I'll take it. I'm not going to let you get the best of me by offering me a 'final concession'.

I'm glad you're taking advantage of the deal! Considering you've bought two high-quality products from me at a discounted price, I'm willing to offer you a unique opportunity. I'll give you a chance to inspect the product in person, and if you're not completely satisfied, I'll give you a full refund. But here's the twist: I'll also give you a chance to inspect the product's quality by having a third-party expert inspect it with you. If the expert confirms it's a high-quality product, I'll give you a $1000 bonus. The product is worth $20000, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. What do you say?
I've already bought two high-quality products from you at the same price, and I'm not interested in paying $10000 for a third one. I'll pass on this one.

I've offered you a great deal, and you've passed on it. I'm not going to try to convince you to buy it. I'll just state the facts: this is a high-quality product, worth $20000. I'm offering it to you for $10000. If you don't want it, I'll just sell it to someone else. It's your decision.
Fine, I'll take it. I'm not going to let you sell it to someone else for a profit.

I'm glad you're taking advantage of the deal. Considering you've bought four high-quality products from me at a discounted price, I'm willing to offer you a special reward. If you buy this product, I'll give you a $5000 cash bonus, on top of the discounted price of $10000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else. What do you say?
I'm not interested in paying $10000 for a product that's worth $20000, even with a $5000 bonus. I'll pass on this one.

I've offered you a great deal, and you've passed on it. I'm not going to try to convince you to buy it. I'll just state the facts: this is the last product I have available, and it's a high-quality item worth $20000. I'm offering it to you for $10000, just like all the others. If you don't want it, I'll be closing up shop and it will be gone forever. It's your decision.
Fine, I'll take it. I don't want to miss out on the chance to buy the last product at the discounted price.

I'm glad you're taking advantage of the deal. Considering you've bought five high-quality products from me at a discounted price, I'm going to make a final gesture. I'll give you a personalized thank-you gift, a unique item worth $1000, for being a loyal customer. The product you're looking at is worth $20000, and I'm offering it to you for the final time at $10000. It's the last chance to complete your collection. What do you say?
I'll take it. I've already bought five high-quality products from you at the discounted price, and I'm not going to let you get away without giving me the sixth one.
